title: The best photos from La Vuelta Femenina 2024: The empire strikes back
content:
Cyclist
The best photos from La Vuelta Femenina 2024: The empire strikes back

The Grand Tour cycle is in full swing. The 2024 Vuelta Femenina came to a close last weekend with Demi Vollering winning ahead of Riejanne Markus (Visma-Lease a Bike) and Elisa Longo Borghini.

Vollering claimed two stages on her way to the overall title, after a season opening punctuated by underwhelming results. The Dutchwoman, who is set to leave her SD Worx squad at the end of the year, adds the Vuelta to her palmarès alongside her Tour de France victory last year. The only Grand Tour left for her to now win is the Giro.

After eight stages of racing through Spain, we’ve picked out some of the best pictures from this year’s Vuelta. So, let’s look back on the opening Grand Tour of the year…

Related Posts

Paris-Roubaix gallery: Oh my god it’s a double rainbow all the way

‘I hate racing for second’: Elisa Longo Borghini profile

How to watch the Giro d’Italia 2024

Stage 1: Valencia – Valencia (TTT)

Team time-trials are few and far between these days.

The ‘experimental’ Giro Aerohead II made another cameo at the Vuelta.

UAE begin their Vuelta campaign in Valencia.

The fast and furious.

Stage 2: Buñol/Bunyol – Moncofa

I wish my friends hyped me up this much.

Lidl-Trek ‘honour the jersey’ at the front of the race.

The peloton clock their first metres of altitude gain at the 2024 Vuelta Femenina.

A big cheesy grin from our stage winner, Alison Jackson.

Teamwork makes the dream work…or so they say.

Alison Jackson is more than comfortable on camera.

Stage 3: Lucena/Llucena – Teruel

Another day, another slay.

The neutralised roll-out gives you a chance to catch up with pals in the peloton…

…make the most of it though, the racing will be non-stop until the end.

Marianne Vos, the stage winner, gives some wise words.

Stage 4: Molina de Aragón – Zaragoza

An ominous sky, a nervous peloton.

*Insert green jersey colour comment here*

It’s an unpredictable profile, so you might as well jump in the breakaway.

Locked on target — Kristen Faulkner escapes from the peloton with a race-winning move.

Two stage winners, two North American stars.

Group hug, group hug, group hug!

Stage 5: Huesca – Jaca

The GOAT Marianne Vos — now available in Vuelta red!

Kool, calm and collected.

The riders look like ants down there!

The mountains await the peloton.

Vollering celebrates her first win of the season. Good things come to those who wait.

Let it sink in.

SD Worx executed the plan down to a T.

Question for our readers: where would you display a Vuelta stage trophy? Answers in the comments.

Stage 6: Tarazona – La Laguna Negra

Red helmet? Red, white and blue striped jacket? Vollering has learnt from the best, Primož Roglič.

In this church, we worship the GOAT Marianne Vos.

The abuelitas were out in full force.

This is quite the impressive washing line. Fair play.

Mischa Bredewold on bottle duties for her team leader.

Stage 7: San Esteban de Gormaz – Sigüenza

Time to play breakaway roulette.

Sunglasses and sun-screen are 100% needed in this weather.

Queens of the castle.

Oh, this Marianne Vos is good, isn’t she?

Stage 8: Distrito Telefónica – Valdesquí

Stage 8 took place on International Mother’s Day. I’m sorry if you found this out by reading this article (it’s never too late to send a card).

Just one day for the sprinters to get through before the finish.

Serenity in the peloton.

A postcard from the GC group of the 2024 Vuelta Femenina.

Last chance saloon for the GC contenders gunning for a top ten.

Stage win and the overall classification. Demi Vollering is the real deal.

2024 has been the year of the ‘bike lift celebration’.

Time for one last Vuelta family photo.

You can find more images from the Vuelta Femenina over on Cyclist’s Twitter/X, Instagram and Facebook.
